Articles.Content: The stack batteries from the Near Future Propulsion pack are good for this, you can get a 2800 Ec battery for 0.625 format.

Mmmm... It does sound rather nice, tough I think I have found a solution. The Lack Luster Labs Communotron 64 is a REALLY large Omni antenna with a 5Mm range, but I do forsee a problem in getting these things up in a aerodynamic fashion

EDIT: Is that pack compatible with KSP Interstellar mod?

Edited February 1, 2014 by guto8797

Mmmm... It does sound rather nice, tough I think I have found a solution. The Lack Luster Labs Communotron 64 is a REALLY large Omni antenna with a 5Mm range, but I do forsee a problem in getting these things up in a aerodynamic fashion

You could just edit the communotron16 range.

Edit you in a career game ?

EDIT that last file, I up will get all in the command pod part but if they have antennas they will more in likely have to be added.

Edited February 1, 2014 by Mecripp2

yep I am in career mode, tough I will not edit the range, I will have to make it do or do without

Thanks you for your help, but i dont think NovaPunch adds antennas.

yep I am in career mode, tough I will not edit the range, I will have to make it do or do without

Thanks you for your help, but i dont think NovaPunch adds antennas.

They pretty much just had the antenna on the thorlanderRCS block.
This is honestly one of the best mods of I have ever seen. Great job on it dude!

I had also noted that that antenna didn't require connection and I totally didn't use that in my Early campaigns to my advantage

Thank you for your help, I'll just not use that RCS block (with so many good alternatives) and I will be fine. The only reason I needed this is that I am deploying my ComSat network, based on a launcher with three M38 Unoccupied Guidance things instead of the Stayputnik because they are way easier to stack.

This is honestly one of the best mods of I have ever seen. Great job on it dude!

I agree. This mod adds so much content, difficulty, control, and realism. It should be fully implemented into the game.

Is it possible to add small onmi antennaes for kerbals on eva ?

Have seen this asked before , but no answers.

It looks like EVAing kerbal is "[kerbalEVA]" part , but it's not just an ordinary part , I can't add antennaes like on stock probes (ModuleRTAntennaPassive) via remote tech config files.

However there is vanguard mod , which adds parachutes to kerbals , and it does so via dll.

Maybe someone already tryed to add onmi for eva ?

After some irritating comms outages for my Minmus exploration crews, I finally sent up a complete six-unit comsat constellation:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Complete global coverage in one launch.

Nice you can use a cfg to add MJ to the pobe core to save part and space.

@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleCommand],!MODULE[MechJebCore]]

{

MODULE

{

name = MechJebCore

}

}

After some irritating comms outages for my Minmus exploration crews, I finally sent up a complete six-unit comsat constellation:

http://imgur.com/a/FRCK4

Complete global coverage in one launch.

That launch vehicle looks amazing!

May I ask what parts you used to build that homemade launch clamp at the bottom?

Is it possible to add small onmi antennaes for kerbals on eva ?

Have seen this asked before , but no answers.

It looks like EVAing kerbal is "[kerbalEVA]" part , but it's not just an ordinary part , I can't add antennaes like on stock probes (ModuleRTAntennaPassive) via remote tech config files.

However there is vanguard mod , which adds parachutes to kerbals , and it does so via dll.

Maybe someone already tryed to add onmi for eva ?

If you use KAS you can set it up to be able to add the small antenna (non animated) on EVA. There is a conflict between that mod and this one where adding this with any animated antennas cause the animation of deployment / extension to no longer function.

That launch vehicle looks amazing!

May I ask what parts you used to build that homemade launch clamp at the bottom?

Looks like most all of it is from

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24867-%28-23%29-FASA-3-73-Saturn-H1-Engine-Geiger-Counter-1-27-14

The mod pack as a launch tower and clamps.
Is there already a fix for the vanishing space center and the copying of ships in sight?

Is there already a fix for the vanishing space center and the copying of ships in sight?

Have you try'ed https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/72893034/RemoteTech2_2014.01.08.22.30.zip

EDIT IT's just a RT2.dll DON'T DELETE your RT2 folder.

EDIT2 There is a fix posted on First post now.

Edited February 1, 2014 by Mecripp2

That launch vehicle looks amazing!

May I ask what parts you used to build that homemade launch clamp at the bottom?

The hold-down clamps are FASA parts, as is most of the launch vehicle (using Titan missile parts).

The clamps are modeled on the real Atlas hold-down clamps and fold back when released:

I thought the scorch marks on the inner side was a nice touch.

Edited February 1, 2014 by RoboRay

Well that might explain why I haven't encountered it, I haven't used KAS parts on my satellites. So basically, KAS and RT can co-exist, but can not cross paths.

So you don't have the Squad antenna's on any of your vehicles? Those are KAS parts. KAS + modulemanager makes them KAS parts because it ties them together. I'm guessing you're actually using a minimum of Squad parts in your play, at least the ones KAS changes.

Edited February 1, 2014 by BigD145
If you have memory issues, use the in memory texture reduction mod. It's really a no-brainer these days.

After some irritating comms outages for my Minmus exploration crews, I finally sent up a complete six-unit comsat constellation:

Complete global coverage in one launch.

A thing of beauty! Love the little sat designs.

Hey guys, a small bug report:

1. A lander made of lander can and a lab lands on a planet. One kerbal is in the can flying the thing, another in the lab.

2. Some experiments are taken and brought to the lab. Both kerbals are now in the lab (noone at the controls).

3. Guess what - lab is staffed, but can not do a thing, as noone is controlling the craft. Now is not that superlame?

BR and hope there is a reasonable fix to this issue.
The lab can't control the vessel, you need to put a kerbal in the lander can.

The lab can't control the vessel, you need to put a kerbal in the lander can.

wrong

the lab CAN control the vessel (perhaps i am wrong, but i have a lab+sample processor in orbit WITHOUT a command pod in orbit; so either of the two DOES control the vessel)

but it doesnt provide torque

you either have to stick an reaction wheel or some RCS thrusters on it.

You would have to have a probe core on it, @lammatt and if AnatolyVasserman doesn't have a core on the lab then he can't or if the lab is connect to the lander can he can't, You try driving from the trunk and tell me whats superlame lol.

wrong

the lab CAN control the vessel (perhaps i am wrong, but i have a lab+sample processor in orbit WITHOUT a command pod in orbit; so either of the two DOES control the vessel)

but it doesnt provide torque

you either have to stick an reaction wheel or some RCS thrusters on it.

I haven't tried the lab but I know the hitchhiker can't and the KSPI lab can't so I assume the stock lab also can't.
